member.name: T:NuGet.StringBuilderPool
member.summary: Provides a resource pool that enables reusing instances of instances.

remarks.para: Renting and returning buffers with an can increase performance in situations where instances are created and destroyed frequently, resulting in significant memory pressure on the garbage collector.
This class is thread-safe. All members may be used by multiple threads concurrently.

member.name: F:NuGet.StringBuilderPool.Shared
member.summary: Retrieves a shared instance.

member.name: M:NuGet.StringBuilderPool.Rent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a that is at least the requested length.
member.param: The minimum capacity of the needed.
member.returns: A that is at least in length.
member.remarks: This buffer is loaned to the caller and should be returned to the same pool via so that it may be reused in subsequent usage of . It is not a fatal error to not return a rented string builder, but failure to do so may lead to decreased application performance, as the pool may need to create a new instance to replace the one lost.

member.name: M:NuGet.StringBuilderPool.Return(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Returns to the pool an array that was previously obtained via on the same instance.
member.param: The previously obtained from to return to the pool.
member.remarks: Once a has been returned to the pool, the caller gives up all ownership of the instance and must not use it. The reference returned from a given call to must only be returned via once. The default may hold onto the returned instance in order to rent it again, or it may release the returned instance if it's determined that the pool already has enough instances stored.
